item.title: Use Lightning and Hydra to train your neural networks
item.description: TL;DR: A tutorial for training a Llama model on protein sequences from scratch with less than 500 lines of code. Deep learning research is moving at an incredible pace, and so are the tools that support rapid experimentation. In this post, we’ll walk through how to harness PyTorch Lightning and Hydra to streamline the training of a deep neural networkâ€”in our case, a Llama model trained on protein sequences, which will allow for protein sequence generation via next amino acid prediction.
